channel.title: Alter Ego
channel.description: Picture the Sims. now take away the aspect of being a "God character" and just being one character. Strip away the graphics and replace them with amazing vignettes and a much more interesting and enjoyable game. You now have Alter Ego. It has wit and humour as well as some slightly disturbing yet realistic parts. It was written by a psychologist who wanted to try something new, and succeeded greatly. It comes in male and female. http://www.abandonia.com/en/games/263/Alter+Ego+(Man+and+Woman).html I do not know (T)opars policy on abandonware, so I will take it down at a staff member's request. Please note that there are some [easily fixable] errors in the male game. You should use Dosbox if you want sound to come from your speakers. Also, press CTL + S to save, however you have to fiddle with the male save games to make saving work. Saving is also not necessary. I have had perfect [yet realistic] endings quite a bit and am amazed by the enjoyment [and even experience!] this game gives.

item.title: Alter Ego
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Picture the Sims. now take away the aspect of being a “God character” and just being one character. Strip away the graphics and replace them with amazing vignettes and a much more interesting and enjoyable game. You now have Alter Ego. It has wit and humour as well as some slightly disturbing yet realistic parts. It was written by a psychologist who wanted to try something new, and succeeded greatly. It comes in male and female. http://www.abandonia.com/en/games/263/Alter+Ego+(Man+and+Woman).html
I do not know (T)opars policy on abandonware, so I will take it down at a staff member’s request.
Please note that there are some [easily fixable] errors in the male game. You should use Dosbox if you want sound to come from your speakers. Also, press CTL + S to save, however you have to fiddle with the male save games to make saving work. Saving is also not necessary. I have had perfect [yet realistic] endings quite a bit and am amazed by the enjoyment [and even experience!] this game gives.
